name: Guest House Douro

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Carmen and Joao were the perfect hosts. They have such an amazing passion for Porto and for their B&B. Carmen was a wealth of knowledge on where to visit and this really helped to streamline our 2 night break. Joao's breakfast was a work of art.
reviews.title: A must stay B&B in Porto

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are spotless (it looked as if they had just been renovated, not a mark or scuff in sight). Yes the rooms are small but the views are the best and location is perfect so it really doesn't matter - you're not spending your holiday in a room?!
reviews.title: If You Can Take The Heat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Porto is such a scenic city but be prepared for some serious hills. The view across the river looking back at the city is worth the effort of crossing the bridge and should be a must do.
reviews.title: a beautifully presented Guesthouse, great hosts, delicious breakfasts.......

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I wasn't a big fan of port before coming here but now i think it's amazing stuff. Try the white or rose ports - this is now my favourite tipple and it tastes nothing like the tawny ports most people have tried. We even had 6 bottles shipped back to the UK.
reviews.title: Great experience!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Porto is a great long weekend destination - relaxed, beautiful and fairly cheap.
reviews.title: Unbelievable, central, clean, architecturally a wow, with fabulous hosts

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we stayed a week at the guest house in june 2001. carmen and joao were great hosts and we had fun with them. joao's breakfasts were beautiful to look at and to eat.
reviews.title: wonderful hosts. fantastic position in oporto

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: carmen and joao always greeted us as friends. they arranged a special restaurant by the atlantic for my partner's birthday including complementary bubbly! it was super.
reviews.title: Incredible Service, but small space

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we joined our hosts for the festival of st joao at a nearby eatery which was very good. after the fireworks our hosts ushered back to our home like mother hens!
reviews.title: Small but good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: fantastic position on the water front in the historic district of oporto and beautiful compact boutique guest house.
reviews.title: The Pearl of Porto

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: obigada carmen and joao
reviews.title: Perfection in Porto

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I didn't believe this place could be as good as the reviews suggested - but it is. We had a charming room overlooking the river. It was quite small but that was made perfectly clear to us when we booked it. It was very tastefully furnished, clean and comfortable. The bathroom was also small but fitted with with very high quality fittings.
reviews.title: Delightful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Carmen and Joao went to great lengths to make sure every guest enjoyed their stay and their recommendations for restaurants and sights to see were excellent.
reviews.title: Another 5 star Review

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Breakfast was an absolute treat - the freshest, ripest fruits we encountered in all our trip were the highlight.
reviews.title: One not to miss

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Whilst it is not cheap, it is good value for money.
reviews.title: We can't wait to go back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Simply put, Carmen and Joao are two of the best hosts in the world. They are the heart and soul of this delightful house sitting on the banks of the Duoro River with fantastic views of the port wine lodges on the opposite shore. Everything they do is perfect, and it feels like your needs are theirs, and they will do everything in their power to fulfill those needs.
reviews.title: The Hospitality, House, Views and Location are Fabulous!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just loved staying here. Carmen and Joao were such gracious hosts and so warm and welcoming. The place is absolutely charming and in such a great location. It is spotless and very tastefully decorated. We had a river view room, which was on the small side, but comfortable and so nicely appointed.
reviews.title: I can't say enough good things

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Both Carmen and Joao were so helpful, from getting us a cab in the pouring rain, to directing us to great restaurants, to advising on options to see the Douro Valley (we ended up driving to Pinhao and taking the train to Pocinho and back).
reviews.title: Lived up to high expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: And the breakfast...what can I say about this breakfast! Not only was it delicious, but it was a work of art, so beautifully presented.
reviews.title: We felt very welcome here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall we really enjoyed our time in Porto, although it wasn't enough (just 2 days). If you happen to be from the NYC area, bring Carmen bagels (she had asked us when she realized where we were from).
reviews.title: Well deserved number 1 in Porto

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good location. Safe. Clean. Excellent hosts Carmen and Joao. Top breakfast.
reviews.title: No need to look further ~ you’ve found your vacation abode

description: Nestled in the heart of historical Oporto, the Guest House Douro offers a unique and personal experience. It is the first and only guesthouse on Oporto's waterfront. Part of UNESCO's World Heritage Site, the G.H.D. enjoys breathtaking vistas. All rooms offer direct views, either of the Douro river, the Dom Luis bridge and the Port lodges that line the riverbank or of the romantic Fonte Taurina, one of the oldest streets of Oporto. Only steps away from an abundance of attractions and historical monuments. Create beautiful memories and let the Guest House Douro be one of them!
